grid.translation[0].definitions[0].defin: a metal frame with bars across it
grid.translation[0].definitions[1].defin: a pattern of straight lines that cross each other and form squares
grid.translation[0].definitions[1].examp: Its streets were laid out in a grid pattern.
grid.translation[0].definitions[2].defin: a set of numbered lines printed on a map so that the exact position of any place can be referred to
grid.translation[0].definitions[2].examp: The pilots were just given a grid reference  (=number referring to a point on a map) of the target.
grid.translation[0].definitions[3].defin: the network of electricity supply wires that connects power stations and provides electricity to buildings in an area
grid.translation[0].definitions[3].examp: the national grid  (=the electricity supply in a country)
grid.translation[0].definitions[4].defin: a set of starting positions for all the cars in a motor race
